pages.text: We will go through all the tier 1 machines, i.e. the machines you can craft from an electronic circuit. Most of these are important for progression, but if one is not, its page will mention it. We will need a lot of iron, copper, redstone and rubber for all of these together.
The electronic circuit is the item all tier 1 machines need. Almost all also need a basic machine frame.
More efficient than the iron furnace, but doesn't give smelting XP. Only needed as ingredient for progression, but very handy for smelting.
More efficient than the iron alloy furnace. Only needed as ingredient for progression, but very handy for alloy smelting.
The grinder is a very important machine. It is capable of grinding ingots to dusts as well as ore blocks, granting double yield for the latter. The industrial grinder is

better though, so don't overdo it. For now, throw in 32 coal (NOT charcoal) or a whole stack if you have one, this will be needed soon. The grinder can also grind down a lot of other items, e.g. blaze rods or glow berries. The latter enables you to get glowstone dust without going to the nether, but you wil need a whole stack of berries for one.
Mainly used for producing plates, but can also compress a few other things.
Can extract dyes from flowers and other things, e.g. string from an old bow. Only needed as ingredient for progression, but doubles yield on rubber from sap.
For your trash, produces scrap. Important for late game, so collect early!
Puts stuff into cells. For automation, but not for progression.
Breaks the block in front of it. Made for engineers, not needed for progression.
Puts a block in front of it. Made for engineers, not needed for progression.
Needs a centrifuge to get zinc out of tin. 1 Zinc and 3 copper ingots alloy to 4 brass ingots.
